doc.title: $35,000 Clean-Up on Eldorado No. 10
doc.plot: Here we show the process of saving the gold after the water is turned off. It is very simple, and consists of lifting the "riffle-boards" and scooping up the gold with an ordinary coal shovel. All this is shown, and the two great pans full of gold as it is piled up in view, and the plentiful $10.00 and $150.00 nuggets handled by the men in the picture are enough to arouse envy in the heart of a stone image.

Here we show the process of saving the gold after the water is turned off. It is very simple, and consists of lifting the "riffle-boards" and scooping up the gold with an ordinary coal shovel. All this is shown, and the two great pans full of gold as it is piled up in view, and the plentiful $10.00 and $150.00 nuggets handled by the men in the picture are enough to arouse envy in the heart of a stone image.
